page.title: 06EDUCATION FACILITIES
page.content: The former village school, which now attracts weary travellers to stop and rest at the "Bridgewater Arms". In 1850 it echoed to the sound of twelve boys and girls receiving istruction in the art of reading and writing. For this the master received the sum of Â£70 per annum. Children now travel to Gainford Primary School or Staindrop or Teesdale Comprehensive School. At the "Bridgewater Arms" you may quench your thirst and order a "whale and chips". The "whale" refers to a generous portion of fish which hangs over the plate. Te "Bridgewater Arms" enjoys patronage from a wide area.
